p: Of the 514 cases clinically diagnosed as DENV infection by sites, 100 (19.5%) were classified by the reference lab as non-dengue; 58 were found to have another pathogen and no pathogen was identified in 42 cases ( Fig 4). Other confirmed pathogens were Rickettsia typhi (20), chikungunya virus (11), Leptospira spp (10), Salmonella typhi/paratyphi (7), influenza A/B virus (5), measles virus (2), Klebsiella pneumoniae (1), entero-pathogenic Escherichia coli (1), and Seoul virus (1). Demography, clinical manifestations, hematology, and biochemistry profiles grouped by identified pathogen are shown in Table 2.
